column2: No home is complete without a proper toolbox. Here’s April and Andy’s: A hammer, a half eaten pretzel, a baseball card, some cartridge that says Sonic and Hedgehog, a scissor half, a flashlight filled with jellybeans.
I’m a simple man. I like pretty, dark-haired women, and breakfast food.
Turkey can never beat cow.
Honor: if you need it defined, you don’t have it.

Fishing relaxes me. It’s like yoga, except I still get to kill something.
The key to burning an ex-wife effigy is to dip it in paraffin wax and then toss the flaming bottle of isopropyl alcohol from a safe distance. Do not stand too close when you light an ex-wife effigy.
Under my tutelage, you will grow from boys to men. From men into gladiators. And from gladiators into Swansons.

The less I know about other people’s affairs, the happier I am. I’m not interested in caring about people. I once worked with a guy for three years and never learned his name. Best friend I ever had. We still never talk sometimes.
